actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.

official_title: a bill to amend the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 to permit persons to bring suits under the Act in Federal district courts without regard to whether any proceedings have been commenced by or on behalf of such persons under the State Law, and for other purposes.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 to permit persons to bring certain suits under such Act in Federal district courts without regard to whether any proceedings have been commenced by or on behalf of such persons under State law. Prohibits persons commencing such State proceedings from bringing such a suit for 60 days after such commencement, unless such proceedings have been terminated earlier.

titles.title: a bill to amend the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 to permit persons to bring suits under the Act in Federal district courts without regard to whether any proceedings have been commenced by or on behalf of such persons under the State Law, and for other purposes.
